trial_identification.studytitle: Study to Investigate the Effects of Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation on Cardiovascular Health in Males Receiving Statin Medication for High Cholesterol Levels
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomised, double blind, placebo controlled, cross over study to investigate the effect of dietary supplementation with coenzyme Q10 on endothelial function in males with the metabolic syndrome who are concurrently on statin treatment.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions: Coenzyme Q10 dietary supplement is a tablet (100mg) to be taken orally, twice daily for 3 months. There is a 1 month washout period between intervention and control or vice versa depending on treatment allocation.
interventions.comparator: Placebo is a sugar pill to be taken orally as 2 tablets twice daily for 3 months.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Flow-mediated dilation of the brachial artery (endothelium dependent function) to be assessed with ultrasound.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 3 months after intervention commencement

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Endothelial independent dilation of the brachial artery to be assessed with ultrasound.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 3 months after intervention commencement

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Augmentation index using a medical device with a pressure sensor to measure the siffness of the blood vessels.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 3 months after intervention commencement

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure assessed with an automated blood pressure monitor.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 3 months after intervention commencement

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Markers of cardiovascular risk measured from blood tests.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 3 months after intervention commencement

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Coenzyme Q10 levels measured from a blood test.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 3 months after intervention commencement

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Quality of Life Scores assessed using a Quality of Life Questionnaire.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 3 months after intervention commencement

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Waist circumference >= 94cm Triglycerides >=1.7 mmol/L or specific therapy for tirglycerides Systolic blood presure >=130 mmHg or Diastolic blood pressure >=85 mmHg or treatment for hypertension Statin naive or treatment with <=40mg/day simvastatin or equivalent
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Pre-treatment Low-density Lipoprotein (LDL)-cholesterol <1.5mmol/L or >6.5 mmol/L Pre-treatment triglycerides >5 mmol/L History of cardiovascular event or intervention within the 6 months prior to screening Type 1 diabetes mellitus Type 2 diabetes mellitus requiring oral anti-diabetic agents or insulin Current smoker Treatment with fibrates or other lipid modifying agents other than statin therapy

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: First Floor, Hagley Hostel Christchurch Hospital Private Bag 4710 Christchurch 8140

fundingsource.fundingname: National Heart Foundation of New Zealand (NZ)

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Canterbury Health Laboratories Corner Hagley Ave and Tuam Street P O Box 151 Christchurch 8140

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Coenzyme Q10 supplementation is increasingly used for the prevention of heart disease. Supplementation with coenzyme Q10 has been shown to improve cardiovascular function in people with type 2 diabetes. Improving cardiovascular function can reduce the risk of heart disease. In a previous study we found that reductions in coenzyme Q10 levels due to statin therapy were associated with improvements in cardiovascular function. We hypothesised that coenzyme Q10 supplementation may enhance the beneficial effect of statin treatment and further contribute to reducing the risk of heart disease. The study aims to investigate whether supplementation with coenzyme Q10 can further improve cardiovascular function in patients taking statin medication and thereby give additional benefit to statin treatment in protection from heart disease.
